text: S. G. Atkins House is a historic home located at Winston-Salem, Forsyth County, North Carolina. The house was built about 1893, and is a two-story, three bay, frame dwelling with rear additions. The front facade has a central gable and a hip-roofed porch. It was built by Dr. Simon Green Atkins, the founder of the Slater Industrial Academy for African-American students. The house was converted to apartments in 1951. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1979. ==References== Category:African-American history in Winston-Salem, North Carolina Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1893 Category:Houses in Winston-Salem, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Winston-Salem, North Carolina
title: S. G. Atkins House
